attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MlNZUbWTRm4NVBqeec8_attack_onhit
attribs.current: 22 (4d10) acid damage plus 11 (2d10) acid per round damage

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MlNZUbWTRm4NVBqeec8_description
attribs.current:
Armor Class 19
Hit Points 100 each

The Arcane Cannon discharges acid in a line 300 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, a creature that fails its saving throw takes 11 (2d10) acid damage at the start of each of its turns; a creature can end this damage by using its action to wash off the acid with a pint or more of water.

It takes one action to aim the Cannon and one action to fire it. After the Cannon has fired, it must Recharge for 5 minutes before it can be fired again.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MlNZUbkIS-OHlzov-aJ_description
attribs.current:
Armor Class 19
Hit Points 100 each

The Arcane Cannon discharges fire in a line 300 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 33 (6d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable Objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried.

It takes one action to aim the Cannon and one action to fire it. After the Cannon has fired, it must Recharge for 5 minutes before it can be fired again.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MlNZUbrwXORcHn5IIIN_description
attribs.current:
Armor Class 19
Hit Points 100 each

The Arcane Cannon shoots a ball of frost to a point you can see within 1,200 feet of the Cannon. The ball then expands to form a 30-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 22 (4d10) cold damage, and its speed is reduced by 10 feet for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and its speed isn’t reduced. A creature whose speed is reduced by this Effect can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, Ending the Effect on itself on a success.

It takes one action to aim the Cannon and one action to fire it. After the Cannon has fired, it must Recharge for 5 minutes before it can be fired again.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MlNZUbxsmdqyED6Zbrg_description
attribs.current:
Armor Class 19
Hit Points 100 each

The Arcane Cannon shoots a ball of lightning to a point you can see within 1,200 feet of the Cannon. The lightning then expands to form a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 33 (6d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures wearing metal armor have disadvantage on the save.

It takes one action to aim the Cannon and one action to fire it. After the Cannon has fired, it must Recharge for 5 minutes before it can be fired again.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MlNZUc2Qv3Z7ukPH4iv_description
attribs.current:
Armor Class 19
Hit Points 100 each

The Arcane Cannon expels poison gas in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 22 (4d10) poison damage and is Poisoned for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn’t Poisoned. A creature Poisoned in this way can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, Ending the Effect on itself on a success.

It takes one action to aim the Cannon and one action to fire it. After the Cannon has fired, it must Recharge for 5 minutes before it can be fired again.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MlNZUc9kmaVfIbXWmZS_description
attribs.current:
Armor Class 15
Hit points 50 each

It takes one action to load the weapon, one action to aim it, and one action to fire it.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MlNZUcMv-qDLHvJkbrt_description
attribs.current:
Armor Class 19
Hit points 75

A cannon is usually supported in a wooden frame with wheels. Before it can be fired, the cannon must be loaded and aimed. It takes one action to load the weapon, one action to aim it, and one action to fire it.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MlNZUcnuxfb8E6xqjH-_description
attribs.current:
Armor Class 15
Hit points 100

A mangonel is a type of Catapult that hurls heavy projectiles in a high arc. This payload can hit Targets behind cover.

Before the mangonel can be fired, it must be loaded and aimed. It takes two Actions to load the weapon, two Actions to aim it, and one action to fire it.

A mangonel typically hurls a heavy stone, although it can hurl other kinds of projectiles, with different Effects.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MlNZUcu19T9XTUY1oou_description
attribs.current:
Armor Class 20
Hit points 100 (damage threshold 10)

The Water Vehicle has advantage on all Saving Throws relating to Crashing when it crashes into a creature or an object. Any damage it takes from the crash is applied to the naval ram rather than to the ship. These benefits don't apply if another vessel crashes into the Water Vehicle.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MlNZUcyxN-mJ2Ut1KAP_description
attribs.current:
Armor Class 15
Hit points 100

It takes a minimum of four Medium creatures to operate a ram. Because of the gallery roof, these operators have total cover against attacks from above.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MlNZUd4q0hy21UlI6vb_description
attribs.current:
Armor Class 19
Hit points 20

The cauldron pours Boiling Oil onto a 10-foot-square area directly below it. Any creature in the area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

attribs.name: repeating_npcaction_-MlNZUdA2J4z1RsUg4cY_description
attribs.current:
Armor Class 15
Hit points 150

A trebuchet is a powerful Catapult that throws its payload in a high arc, so it can hit Targets behind cover. Before the trebuchet can be fired, it must be loaded and aimed. It takes two Actions to load the weapon, two Actions to aim it, and one action to fire it.

A trebuchet typically hurls a heavy stone. However, it can launch other kinds of projectiles, such as barrels of oil or sewage, with different Effects.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlNZUdGp06LGBHPpq6F_description
attribs.current: Using methods similar to those used to produce magic weapons, a skilled spellcaster imbues a ship’s weapon with destructive energy. This weapon gains a +2 bonus to its attack and damage rolls, and its attacks count as magical.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlNZUdHKc6DSun3Avyc_description
attribs.current: Enhanced by abjuration magic, this weapon’s attacks burst with raucous noise capable of momentarily distracting and disorienting enemy crews. If this weapon hits a vehicle’s hull, that vehicle’s speed decreases by 2d10 feet until the start of the attacker’s next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlNZUdIhDJrUScUHSfj_description
attribs.current: Drawing on powerful evocation magic, this weapon’s attacks are imbued with unstable energy that explodes in a fiery blast. When this weapon hits, it deals an extra 2d6 fire damage.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlNZUdJM0uxPLYQppuJ_description
attribs.current: This weapon creates spectral chains that trail after its shots, restraining enemy vessels in their grasp. When this weapon hits a ship, that vehicle must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or it can’t move away from the attacker. As an action, the attacking ship can end this effect, and the target can end it by taking an action and succeeding on a DC 14 Strength check.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlNZUdKKUb0kPAMs4BQ_description
attribs.current:
If a siege weapon gets a "To Hit" bonus, the modifier is instead replaced with the Crew Morale, or if operated by a Player Character the Player's Proficiency Bonus.

Crew Morale is recorded on the NPC sheet as "Performance+X" under skills.

attribs.name: repeating_npctrait_-MlNZUdL3XpjIfSSerZC_description
attribs.current: The following upgrades can apply to any weapon mounted aboard a ship. A component can gain the benefits of one upgrade, or two upgrades if one of the upgrades is Arcane Artillery.
